summary: The Great Lakes Mapping Act of 2025 directs the Administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to conduct high-resolution surveying and mapping of the Great Lakes lakebeds by December 31, 2030. This includes creating a detailed map, collecting bathymetric data, cataloging existing and new data, and coordinating with various entities. The Administrator is mandated to make data publicly available and will incorporate it into additional products. The bill authorizes $50 million per year from 2025 to 2029 for this purpose.
